com.appglu.android.log
Interface Logger

All Known Implementing Classes:
AndroidLogger
public interface Logger

Provides all type of methods for logging to the console at any LoggerLevel.
You can verify if a level is enabled for logging by calling the correspondent "isLevelEnabled" method. For example: isDebugEnabled().
There are two options for logging a message and two options for logging an exception for each LoggerLevel.

You can have access to a Logger instance by using a LoggerFactory.getLogger(String) method, like below:

Logger logger = LoggerFactory.getLogger("LOGGER_TAG");

To have access to a Logger instance, you can also send a Class as a paramter to LoggerFactory.getLogger(Class).
In this case the simple name of the class will be the log tag. For example:

Logger logger = LoggerFactory.getLogger(this.getClass());

The default level to be used is LoggerLevel.INFO but that can be change by calling LoggerFactory.setLevel(LoggerLevel) or AppGluSettings.setLoggerLevel(LoggerLevel) before initializing AppGlu.

Since:
1.0.0
See Also:
LoggerLevel, LoggerFactory
